snippet: President Milos Zeman’s confirmation of a leftist loyalist as prime minister was done in open defiance of the main parties in Parliament.
abstract: Pres Milos Zeman of Czech Republic swears in leftist interim government after corruption and spying scandal that forced Prime Min Petr Necas to resign; confirmation of leftist loyalist and former finance minister Jiri Rusnok as prime minister is done in open defiance of main parties in Parliament.

byline.contributor: Jana Marie Preiss contributed reporting from Prague.

lead_paragraph: President Milos Zeman’s confirmation of a leftist loyalist as prime minister was done in open defiance of the main parties in Parliament.

headline.main: Czech Leader Swears In Interim Government
headline.print_headline: Czech Leader Swears in Interim Government
